qas.question: What architecture types does Windows 8 support?
How does the online Windows installer know which version to install?

answers.text: automatically installs the version corresponding with the architecture of the system's existing Windows installation

qas.question: What architecture types does Windows 9 support?
What architecture types doesn't Windows 8 support?

plausible_answers.text: automatically installs the version corresponding with the architecture of the system's existing Windows installation

qas.question: How does the online Windows installer know which version to uninstall?

context: The three desktop editions of Windows 8 support <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>32-bit and 64-bit<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> architectures; retail copies of Windows 8 include install DVDs for both architectures, while the online installer <a3_0><b8_0>automatically installs the version corresponding with the architecture of the system's existing Windows installation<b8_0/><a3_0/>. The 32-bit version runs on CPUs compatible with x86 architecture 3rd generation (known as IA-32) or newer, and can run 32-bit and 16-bit applications, although 16-bit support must be enabled first. (16-bit applications are developed for <a1_0><b6_0>CPUs compatible with x86 2nd generation<b6_0/><a1_0/>, first conceived in <a2_0><b7_0>1978<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Microsoft started moving away from this architecture after Windows 95.)
